admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund: TF023485-USDOE-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY ACTIVITIES,TF020930-NEW ZEALAND CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF031104-INDONESIA - ENERGY

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Rural Electrification (RE)
            Project was rated as satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            from this project include: 1) Rural electrification program
            must be financially sustainable and the implementing
            organization must be financially accountable. 2) Holding
            management accountable for financial performance down to
            region and branch levels is required to increase cost
            efficiency of RE services. 3) Productive uses promotion was
            effective in increasing economic benefits and revenues. 4)
            Electricity consumption by key consuming categories must be
            included as Key Performance Indicators as this is a better
            indicator of benefits from a project, rather than just the
            number of connections made. 5) Centralized project
            management was effective in monitoring progress but less
            effective in directing change. 6) Complex procurement
            procedures cause implementation delays and inefficiencies.
            7) Management commitment supported by timely, accurate and
            accessible information is essential for effective management
            and increasing the efficiency of rural electrification.
